sender.title: Professor of Pathology and Translational Molecular Pathology
sender.summary: I am a Professor of Pathology and Translational Molecular Pathology at MD Anderson Cancer Center. I am also the Scientific Director and Co-Director of The Sheikh Ahmed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan Center for Pancreatic Cancer Research. You can follow me on twitter @aiims1742.  A brief overview of research can be found at https://gsbs.uth.edu/faculty/faculty-directory/faculty-profiles.htm?id=de2cb7be-2226-4310-85c5-f9c07286b667

msg: Hi Mark, we have some things in common, specifically around pancreatic cancer research and I'd like to connect.

sender.title: CEO
sender.summary: Focused on Post-EHR Cloud, Connected Care and Big Data analytics, applications and services.

msg: Hi Mark, we have some things in common and I’d like connect.

sender.title: CSO
sender.summary: I am passionate about developing novel medicines to address the pathogenic mechanisms of important human diseases. For instance, I investigated beta amyloid peptide’s impact on the complement cascade and innate immunity in the age-related macular degeneration. My team elucidated the critical roles of the cytokine interleukin 7 in the effector memory T cell function and pathogenesis of multiple sclerosis and type 1 diabetes. My responsibility has expanded into leading the overall strategy of cancer immunology at Pfizer, including novel checkpoint inhibitors and genetically engineered T cell therapy, since 2013.

msg: Hi Mark, we have some things in common and I’d like connect.  I'm interested in learning more about the work you've been doing with mapping the target space for different types of cancer.
